channel.title: reproducibility on Granular Material
channel.description: Recent content in reproducibility on Granular Material

item.title: AI Dermatology: Part 2
item.description: ​In the last post, I discussed the possible broader implications of Google’s recent foray into making an AI dermatology tool. In this follow up post, I want to focus on the research behind the product announcement, bringing a slightly critical eye.

item.title: Reproducibility in Art and Science
item.description: Marking the beginning of a new partnership between Rhizome and the Google Cultural Institute, the Rhizome blog recently published a conversation between Dragan Espenschied, Rhizome’s preservation director, and Vint Cerf, Google’s Chief Internet Evangelist. In addition to bringing together two people with among the coolest job titles ever, it got me thinking about some similarities between art and science when it comes to the issue of reproduction. The main thrust of the conversation is about the difficulty of preserving internet art.
